entry.title: One Dance, Just Once
entry.summary:
Author: dropsof_rain

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,866Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: The slow and melodic chatter of the guests, the music that echoes through the building, and the sweet yet savory scent of the food that is out in the open— free for guests to take. Loud yet blurring chatter around, as the bartender pours drinks by the counter.A lively scenery, a place not meant for him.To his surprise, a journalist sits across him.Or, Bruce meets a journalist at a fundraiser who later drags him out of his seat for a dance.

entry.title: What is a Bat if not for his Two Wings?
entry.summary:
Author: acatcam

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 51,909Chapters: 33/?Kudos: 613

Summary: Bruce Wayne had spent years perfecting the art of being underestimated. The impulsive, table-dancing, ice-sculptor-grinding, billion-dollar himbo persona kept people from looking too closely — especially at Gotham’s other nocturnal resident.But with the Justice League newly formed, curiosity was brewing, and one caped Kryptonian in particular was determined to uncover the man behind the Bat. Clark Kent, investigative journalist and alien protector, was convinced Bruce Wayne’s friendship with Batman meant something more — maybe funding, maybe shared secrets. The problem? Bruce knew Clark’s game, and he was going to play it better. When a gala-turned-villain-attack forced Bruce to act in his Wayne persona and Superman swooped in to save him, the lines between charm and suspicion blurred. Bruce, ever the flirt, ran his hand over Superman’s bicep with a grin and purred, “You saved my life just for a question?”It was going to take more than x-ray vision to win this bet.When a simple bet turns to much more than two players hoped.

entry.title: World's Finest
entry.summary:
Author: Salamence_373

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,437Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 32

Summary: Clark is new to Metropolis after landing his dream job as a journalist at the Daily Planet that's in a frenzy covering the new hero Superman that's moved to town. Bruce has been fighting as Batman for three years but still has a long way to go juggling his double life. These two have been searching for meaning as they strive towards their ultimate goals on an inevitable collision course. Their rivalry sparks new passion from both of them as they find out they aren't so different after all, while finding what's been missing from their lives. They each bring out the best in each other and make them better heroes and people as they build for a better tomorrow.

entry.title: Bring Me To Life Again
entry.summary:
Author: iloveyaoibtw

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,132Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 42

Summary: His heartbeat stayed steady. Good. Because Bruce had never felt a flutter for anything. Clark forced down the seizing pain in his chest, lingering at the doorway for just a few seconds, knowing those deep blue eyes he had drowned in too long were watching him. Watching him carefully. As if, if he lingered even a little longer, he’d break and go back. The distance from him to Bruce was only seven steps.

entry.title: A House to a Bird Is a Cage
entry.summary:
Author: acatcam

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,830Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 25

Summary: Clark Kent came to the city with a duffel bag, a scholarship, and manners you can’t shake after eighteen years. He didn’t plan on joining a frat, but one night he blinked and found himself in The Supers house, beer in hand, everyone calling him “brother.”Across the quad sits Wayne Hall — The Bats — run by Bruce Wayne with the kind of cold precision that makes people nervous. Pressed collars, smudged eyeliner, and a stare you can’t read.Clark saw him once on the front steps, cigarette glowing in the dark. Said hi without thinking. Bruce didn’t answer — just flicked the ash and vanished inside. It should’ve ended there.It didn’t.Now there’s the heat of frat rivalries, the blur of parties and late-night classes, and two lives running parallel but colliding in ways Clark can’t ignore. Curiosity or something heavier — he’s not sure he wants to know.

entry.title: A Lilac Love
entry.summary:
Author: TheBobblehat

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,916Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 109

Summary: Sequel to LAVENDER MARRIAGEIt's been three months since Clark was shot with a bullet of lavender kryptonite, impressing him with false memories of his marriage to Bruce Wayne. After a tumultuous balancing act between truth, lies, and certain death, Clark is finally free of the kryptonite's influence, but not its after effects. In the aftermath, Clark confessed his true feelings for Bruce, who eventually let his walls down long enough to give dating a shot.Now in the midst of a brand new(ish) relationship, they aim to keep it business as usual for Batman and Superman. But the League is getting suspicious, and when an old face returns under strange circumstances, their delicate relationship may not be able to weather the storm.

entry.title: Temptation is One Hell of a Thing
entry.summary:
Author: acatcam

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 36,012Chapters: 20/?Kudos: 98

Summary: Bruce Wayne never expected to walk into a church again—let alone with his four-year-old son in his arms. But when a meeting with Clark Kent, a priest. It turns into more than polite conversation, Bruce finds himself disarmed by a man who shouldn’t have surprised him at all. Clark is broad-shouldered, and impossibly kind; a believer in things Bruce turned his back on the day of his parents’ funeral.Bruce is skeptical, Clark is steadfast. Their ideologies clash from the moment they sit across from one another: billionaire pragmatism versus the faith of a priest. But somewhere between coloring books at Clark’s desk and quiet invitations to community fairs, a dangerous warmth grows. Bruce doesn’t know how to name it, and Clark doesn’t dare.Because whatever is happening between them—it shouldn’t. Bruce pushes, searching for the language he can’t bring himself to say aloud, while Clark whispers what he shouldn’t confess at all: I can’t. A vow binds him to the Church, but his heart betrays him in every secret meeting, every glance held too long.It shouldn’t work. It can’t work. But it does. And as much Clark Kent prays, temptation seeps through.

entry.title: crawl inside, wait by the light of the moon
entry.summary:
Author: brucewaynessluttyboots (missakwatson)

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,187Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 83

Summary: They have a system (a *rhythm*, Clark would insist): long after the sun has slipped safely past the horizon, one of them sends a text. Approximately thirty to forty five minutes later, Clark floats down to Bruce’s balcony and quietly steps through the French doors, which are unlocked just long enough for him to slip inside.They have a system, and it works, and Bruce has allowed it to continue—this novel intrusion that quickly settles into the other systems that make up his routine. He doesn’t want more. Doesn’t need more.Until, one night, he does.
